reviews.review: One of the best single player FPSes out there! I nominated this one for a Steam Award.

Through a compelling storyline, and beautiful artistic design this game shines.  You can spend hours wandering through the markets and enjoying the utopia that is "Heaven, or the closest we'll see until judgement day."  At the beginning it seems like a simple assignment to bring back a girl and wipe away the debt, but as the story evolves it falls deeper into termoil.  The only negative aspect is the sound design.  Many times I could not tell where enemies were, when they shouted or shot I could not tell if they were on my left or right.  I could not find an quick save so be prepared to either play until major checkpoints or minimize the game.

Great game and rediculiously good for a sequel. Recommend 100%. i got it on sale but i would have paid full price for sure. Gameplay is fast paced and the scenery makes it an art peice. I love how the story just throws you into the action as your trying to figure out whats going on. at first it may look like  a peaceful place but it has a dark story behind it.
Beautiful!

The storyline to this game is fantastic. In my opinion i would say this is one of the best single player game I ever played.
But at the same time while this game is fantastic and marvelous, there's still some pros and cons about this game.

Pros

+ Action that you can't really have any detestation for.
+ The storyline is easy to understand and manageable.
+ The extra DLC that comes with the game (The [b] [i] [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/214933/?snr=1_5_9__405] season pass [/url]  [/i] [/b]) is worth the money.
+ The art

Cons

- The characters animations don't sync 100% with the dialogue
- Some minor glitches when it comes to the mechanics of CQC fighting
- Elizabeth glitches out some time and disappears for a moment.
- No savepoints

Now here are some extras things that might be considered a pro or con to some people.

-/+ No multiplayer nor Co-op 
-/+ The default control layout
-/+ Have no link of the previous game in the series
-/+ Season Pass for free DLC.
Awesome game! It's the third time I'm playing,

Es un juego el cual tienes que jugar con paciencia y entendiendo todo poco a poco, te lo pasarás más de 1 vez seguro. Yo me enamoré de el.

Необыкновенно красивое исполнение. 13 часов удовольствия без отрыва (судя по неполученным достижениям и прохождению не на хардмоде, удовольствие можно растянуть). Определенно стоит поиграть вне зависимости от любимого жанра. Если не любите экшн - ставьте на изимод и наслаждайтесь интерактивным кино. Биошок в ряду шедевров прошедшего года достойна, чтобы на нее посмотреть.

Cet opus de Bioshock nous fait quitter les fonds marins de Rapture et innaugure une toute nouvelle ville, Columbia, une ville flotante que l'on pourrais qualifier de paradis.

Bioshock Infinite dispose d'une histoire, d'une mise en scène et d'un level design beaucoup plus soigné que ses ancètres, le jeu est devenu plus dynamique et palpitant à jouer.
Le game design du jeu emprunte tout les acquis des précédents Bioshock en y ajoutant quelques éléments de gameplay supplémentaire.

Malgré quelques textures un peu baveuses, grâce à sa direction artistique le jeu dispose d'un rendu visuel époustouflant qui ne manquera pas de satisfaire vos yeux durant 15h de voltige dans les rues de Columbia.

Le seul défaut qu'on peux lui reprocher c'est de ne pas avoir proposé de new-game+ car le jeu est orienté exploration et en une partie il est tout simplement impossible d'améliorer toutes les armes et les capacités du personnage on a au final le sentiment d'avoir loupé quelque chose.

Il n'y a rien à dire, Irrationnal Games a su nous livrer un triple A de très grande qualité qui restera un GRAND jeu parmis les meilleurs.

Mention: Excellent

Steam needs a Maybe between the Yes and No. Its a lot better than BioShock 2 was but still doesn't manage to capture my interest as the first BioShock did. I love this game, I picked it up for 10 USD and I was very impressed with the story line and how everything fell into place. Bioshock infinte felt like it could be the next sequal to Dishonored but never the less, this game is very fun and looks absoultly beautiful with the indepth Red and Organge colors. This is the reason PC gaming is at the peek of quality.
This game is.... amazing, for a lack of a better word. It'll keep you interested with its amazing story, even with its rather lack luster shooting.

Really excellent game. Visually stunning, great combat, I like the fact it's not too hard on you if you lose health, and will send you to a nearby safe spot to continue killing enemies (who's own health hasn't revived). I've lost count of the number of times Elizabeth has had to revive me with a shot of something! I love the "vigors" too. Only gripe is the two-gun restriction, I really would like to try out other guns without giving up my upgraded items. Also the looking through stethoscopes just to achieve "looked through a million stethoscopes" achievement is somewhat tedious. Aside from that, it's good fun.

Vastly improved graphics, all new weapons, tonics, and new moves make this a vastly different Bioshock from the first two. Even the story and the environment is a whole new world. The game starts off a little slow and feels like a shooter on rails at first but give this game a chance. By the ending you'll be glad you played through the slow parts. The story is probably now the best in the series, the action has more variety, and the final fight sequence is stunning as well as challenging. Easily game of the year.

When I saw [URL="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FuKFAGa1wfs"]the beta gameplay[/URL] of Bioshock, I thought: "It could become the best FPS I ever saw". There were promised stealth, Plasmids (at that time they were usable together with the weaponry, as it was clearly intended from the beginning and how it was starting from BioShock 2)...

But the most important thing they promised was freedom. We were promised Rapture - the place where is no god (linear design), no king (scripted scenes that are required to proceed), only man - the player!

"It's all about choice, it's all about options." - Ken Levine
"[URL="http://youtu.be/FuKFAGa1wfs?t=9m47s"]It's all dynamic, none of this is scripted[/URL]" - Ken Levine

Now, what we see in the game that was released to the market? An Xbox-crippled corridor shooter with the plot full of self-irony about [I][B]no freedom at all[/B][/I]. And do you remember why the Teleport Plasmid was cut out? Because it would let the player to avoid scripts that made the whole game instead of AI and game world.

But that was okay. It was a good, very good Xbox-crippled corridor shooter. I like it very much even like this.

But years passed, and we moved many kilometers up. Project Icarus a.k.a. BioShock Infinite. We were promised free exploration on the dynamic city in the sky (while fleeing the free-roaming Songbird and hiding from him). [URL="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HANw9DJu6h8"]We were promised civil war[/URL] and ability to participate. We were promised all-new vigor system [URL="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K2EGC0HQoKQ"]with separate charges for each of them, [B]lots [/B]of choices[/URL] and really groovy abilities (just look at that telekinesis gun use!). Just for protocol: I know these trailers are fully scripted, but the were a promise the developers made to all customers of the first release.

And what we see now? We see good graphics. Is that all? Yes, it is. Vigors turned out [B]worse[/B] than Plasmids, the only big change was inability to store hypos and inability to get "one use while there is still some EVA", the principle that was the foundation of Hypnotize Big Daddy price and overall Vigors are weaker and bleaker than Plasmids (so what we can make a trap from almost each of them? I would gladly trade this ability for Security Beacon and Natural Camouflage. And oh, Telekinesis. We don't have it anymore). Also, we don't have as much weapon choice: No additional ammunition, no upgrades, only two guns to have - Keep It Simple and Stupid. But do you think it was the worst thing?
I don't I think the worst thing was the fact that when in the first BioShock we at least had some choice that affected at least the ending, now we have none. throw or not was not a choice, you couldn't do neither. Cage of bird? It didn't affect anything than the neck of Elisabeth that you can never see up close as she avoids aim reticule.
And the epic plot about the fate of Floating city became a story of interdementional, but all the more petty squabble about parental rights with both of the fathers being crazy, stubborn [B]and[/B] stupid.

I must still admit - this one isn't always a corridor shooter. At times it is a different type of FPS - a bridge shooter, where you make a step to the side and faaaaaaaaaaaaaaaall.

I sincerely believe that if Andrew Ryan were with us, he would surely ask the developers:
"Are you men or slaves of [URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xbox"]a machine[/URL]?"
A fun game to play through, but I feel it doesn't live up to the original in Rapture.

A modern classic (With an amazing port) 9/10 (I have only gone about 3 hours in as of writing this review, but via the wonderful place called the Internet I have already found out the twist, and I have seen the last 20 minutes because what else did I have to lose?)

+A great plotline (with a twiiist)
+Beautiful graphics that push the U3 engine to its limits (but it can run on a toaster)
+Incredibly well written/Well acted
+somehow, doesn't feel like an escort mission
+most of the guns feel satisfying
+the skyhook feels great to use
+the world is incredibly detailed

-a simple checkpoint system would have been better than the same revival animation over and over and over again
-a sharp difficulty curve about 1 1/2 hours in
-some of the special enemies feel a bit bullet sponge-ey
-the villain seems cartoonish

verdict: a great game, but get it on sale

Dustforce truly is a work of art. I don't mean that lightly. The way it's animated plus its music gives it that title in my book. I can find myself playing one level for an hour, maybe even hours at a time. The frustration of losing levels is filled with relaxation and calmness because of the ambient music. The way the levels are crafted is truly mindblowing. They had a system in which you had to perfect a level to earn a key, and you would use that key to earn more levels. In layman's terms, to earn more levels, you had to perfect current levels. They ditched that and added an XP system in which you gain more XP to earn a key the more levels you play and perfect. I'm very glad they added this system and was skeptical about buying it. But now that I did buy it, I do not regret it even for a second. One thing I really love about this game is how you don't have to unlock base levels. In a sense, this game is open world. That sense is that many levels are available to you, and you can choose whether you want to advance into more challenging levels, or stay where you're at. To get an S in completion, you have to sweep up EVERY leaf, and to get an S in Finesse, you have to maintain your combo throughout an entire level. 

Another thing I absolutely enjoy about Dustforce is its expasive community. There are lots of Community Workshop maps for you to sharpen your skills on, and lots of people who can set a good example. I'm sure most of the people who get best times on all the levels have a Youtube channel, so you can probably catch them there. The community may or not be active, but it sure is good and friendly.

Overall, in terms of gameplay, music, artstyle, animation, and difficulty (it's not an easy game, but it's not that hard of a game either. It just depends on how much you want to play it), I rate this game:

10/10
BUY THIS GAME.

To begin, the storyline of this game has been one of the most amazing I have seen in my life. The graphics of the game are amazing: that is, if you have a computer to support it. Even while playing on the lowest settings my game hasn't been top frameratewise and reactionwise. But I had no problems getting through on normal. 
I do miss something of a toturial and directions. You have to figure a lot out yourself. Including the shortly mentioned autosave system which you probably miss, the game autosaves at certain points while you are unable to save yourself. Because of this you will have to keep playing untill an autosavepoint which can in some cases take quite a while (1+ hour).
Nontheless, the story makes up for every flaw I have encountered.
The kind of game that will be a bookmark for future shooters to come.Game devs take note, story is -just- as important as the game itself.

the vox populi are a truly equal group with women and black members treated no different than male and white members. the murderous apartheid regime forced the revolutionaries into violence through flagrant abuse of human rights - all the blood spilt is on the hands of the racist government. further, daisy fitzroy can't be blamed for trying to kill an imposter posing as the dead hero booker (as far as she's concerned - it's not public knowledge that elizabeth can literally travel into alternate realities).

the revolutionaries are unequivocally the good guys. the correct course of action after daisy decides you are a loose end that needs tying up is to jump off the side of columbia and then turn the game off content in the knowledge that you liberated the oppressed peoples from segregation and dehumanisation.

FPSのFOVが狭いので、３D酔いしやすい人は
以下の方法で広げてください。

Documents\my games\BioShock Infinite\XGame\Config 内にある
XUserOptions.ini をテキストエディタで開き、
MaxUserFOVOffsetPercent=15.000000を
→MaxUserFOVOffsetPercent=57.140000にしてください。
